simplesect.para: Borderless mode allows Cheese to run without window decorations, creating a minimal UI perfect for always-visible webcam monitoring or integration into custom workflows. In borderless mode, the window can be resized very small (down to 64x36 pixels) and positioned anywhere on the screen.

refsect1.title: Starting in Borderless Mode
refsect1.para: To start Cheese in borderless mode, use the --borderless or -b command-line option:
You can also toggle borderless mode at runtime using the F4 keyboard shortcut.

refsect1.title: Window Controls
refsect1.para: In borderless mode, the window can be controlled using the mouse:

listitem.para: Left mouse button: Click and drag to move the window around the screen.
Right mouse button: Click and drag from any corner to resize the window. The window will automatically maintain the camera's aspect ratio to ensure the preview fills the available space without gaps.

refsect1.para: The window is divided into four quadrants for corner detection:

listitem.para: Top-left quadrant: Resize from top-left corner
Top-right quadrant: Resize from top-right corner
Bottom-left quadrant: Resize from bottom-left corner
Bottom-right quadrant: Resize from bottom-right corner

refsect1.title: Aspect Ratio Preservation
refsect1.para: When resizing in borderless mode, Cheese automatically adjusts the window size to maintain the camera's aspect ratio. This ensures that:

listitem.para: The video preview fills the available viewport space without gaps
The window size accounts for UI elements (header bar, action bar, thumbnails) to provide accurate sizing
The window is automatically patched on startup to remove any initial gaps

refsect1.para: The aspect ratio is calculated from the camera's current video format, ensuring the preview always displays correctly regardless of the camera resolution.

refsect1.title: Minimum Window Size
refsect1.para: The window has a minimum size of 64x36 pixels to ensure basic functionality and visibility. Attempts to resize below this minimum will be automatically constrained.

refsect1.title: Combining with Other Features
refsect1.para: Borderless mode works well when combined with other mini-UI features:

listitem.para: --noactionbar: Hide the action bar for an even more minimal interface
--nothumbnails: Hide thumbnails to maximize preview space
--follow: Make the window follow the cursor, perfect for small overlay windows
--topmost: Keep the window always on top for monitoring
